forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 45. West southwest wind 3 to 7 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 51 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 3 to 7 mph.

weather_report:
As evening deepens over Downtown San Francisco, the sky wears a gauzy veil of clouds, whispering hints of the crisp air that wraps the city in an embrace of tranquility. The murmur of the wind is gentle, carrying with it an invitation to step outside and breathe in the bracing scent of impending fog rolling in from the ocean. With temperatures settling into the lower forties, this is the time for layers—perhaps a lightweight sweater beneath a thicker coat, comfortable enough to stroll down the streets, yet snug against the chill of the bay.

The conditions promise a day that straddles the line of luminosity and somber gray. Cloud coverage will dance with intermittent bursts of sunshine, especially as the morning melts into the afternoon, while temperatures hover in the mid-fifties. However, the romantic interlude of fog will weave its way through the buildings and streets, particularly towards the coast, painting the iconic skyline in muted tones of gray and white. As the day unfolds, the elegance of a walk along the Embarcadero, perhaps stopping for a warm drink at one of the cozy cafes, could be the sort of mundane indulgence the spirit craves on a day like this. Engaging with the city’s rich patchwork of life—immersed in a book at a quiet corner or simply gazing across the bay—feels particularly right amidst the serene embrace of the fog.
